articles.title: CCNR Issues Open Questionnaire to S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
CCNR Issues Open Questionnaire to S. Korean Authorities
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Consultative Council for National Reconciliation (CCNR) issued an open questionnaire addressed to the south Korean authorities on Friday.
					 In the questionnaire, the Council said that the statement of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country of the DPRK, which clarified the principled stand to usher in a new era for the improved north-south relations and independent reunification on the basis of the noble idea of By Our Nation Itself on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration, has commanded unanimous support of all the fellow countrymen in the north and the south and abroad.
					
					 But the present south Korean authorities keep mum about the fundamental and principled issue for improvement of the north-south relations, reading the faces of the U.S. and the conservative group, and do not hesitate to reveal their scheme for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK, finding fault with its legitimate step for bolstering the nuclear force for self-defense, it pointed out.
					
					 Saying that due to such irresolute and inappropriate attitude, the north-south relations still fail to escape from the mire of catastrophe even an inch, in like manner as the period of the conservative regime, the CCNR made the following open questionnaire to the south Korean authorities in the name of the whole nation:
					
					1. Do you have a willingness to reject cooperation with foreign forces and solve the north-south relations independently on the basis of the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					2. Can you make a decision to stop the south Korea-U.S. joint military exercises, main factor of aggravating the situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					3. Do you have a will to unconditionally stop all sorts of mud-slinging inciting mistrust and animosity between the fellow countrymen.
					
					4. Can you respond to the DPRK's stand on taking practical measures to remove military conflicts between the north and the south.
					
					5. Are you ready to come out for a dialogue with the DPRK, without raising "the north's nuclear issue".
					
					6. Can you retract the stand for "sanctions and pressure accompanied by dialogue", recognizing that it would only worsen the north-south relations.
					
					7. Can you take bold steps to liquidate the wrongdoings of the conservative group of traitors that brought catastrophic results--total rupture of the north-south relations.
					
					8. Can you show their willingness for improved north-south relations by repatriating DPRK women citizens who were abducted by the conservative group.
					
					9. Can you actively join in the unanimous desire and efforts of all the fellow countrymen in the north and the south and overseas for holding a pan-national conference.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should give definite answers to these questions reflecting the will of the whole nation, mindful that all Koreans are watching their attitude, the Council stressed.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Mozambican President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Mozambican President
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on June 20 sent a message of greeting to Filipe Jacinto Nwussi, president of Mozambique, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to strengthen and wished the president good health and happiness and him and the Mozambican people success in their work for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK Red Cross Society Leaves for Spain
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK Red Cross Society Leaves for Spain
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Executive Vice-Chairman Paek Yong Ho left here Saturday to visit Spain.

articles.title: Campaign for Preventing Drought Damage Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Campaign for Preventing Drought Damage Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A brisk campaign is being carried out on a nationwide scale in the DPRK to prevent western coastal granaries from drought damage.
					 In particular, a long dry spell lingers on in South Hwanghae Province with only 60 mm of average rainfall from April 1 to mid-June, one third of the average yearly precipitation.
					
					 Dry weather also holds long in Pyongyang City and North and South Phyongan and North Hwanghae provinces.
					
					 According to a meteorologist, it is expected to have sporadic rain in the northern part and western coastal areas of the country till the end of June, but it would not be enough to overcome drought.
					
					 Due measures have been taken to prevent the drought damage.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province has restored over 11,500 wells, 1,600 water holes, hundreds of tube-wells, tens of underground reservoirs and 1,630 barrages, while tapping thousands of vehicles and small water pumps into flowing paddy fields and spraying foliar nutrients.
					
					 The same is true of rural communities in Pyongyang and North Hwanghae Province.
					
					 Officials of ministries and national institutions and citizens are also taking part in the campaign to overcome drought.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists, Provoker of Korean War
articles.content:
UN Flag Usurped in Enlarging Korean War
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Korean war in the 1950s was the war of aggression provoked by the U.S. imperialists with multinational forces involved under the cloak of the "United Nations Forces".
					 After occupying the southern part of Korea, the U.S. was desperately keen on reducing the whole of Korea into its colony and advanced base for invading Asia.
					
					 For this purpose, the U.S. stepped up war preparations against the DPRK. And prior to the Korean war, its State Department formed groups in charge of preparing documents and resolutions to be presented and adopted at the UNSC and UN General Assembly.
					
					 On the eve of the war, American warmonger Dulles promised traitor Syngman Rhee of south Korea that if the south Korean puppet army held out for only two weeks after the war outbreak, the U.S., in the meantime, would prosecute north Korea for attacking the south at the UN and pressure the UN into mobilizing multinational forces in the name of UN.
					
					 On June 25, 1950, the south Korean puppet clique unleashed a war against the DPRK at the instigation of the U.S. imperialists. At the same time, the U.S. imperialists brought the issue of Korean war to the UNSC and railroaded the resolution No. 82 to brand the DPRK as an "aggressor". And on June 27, they cooked up the UN resolution No. 83 to justify their armed intervention in the war.
					
					 On July 7, the U.S. imperialists convened a UNSC meeting again to adopt an illegal "decision" on organizing the U.S.-led "UN forces" by using their yes-men.
					
					 Thus, one third of the U.S. ground force, one fifth of its air force and most of its Pacific Fleet and troops from its 15 satellite countries, including UK, France, Canada and Turkey, were fed into the war.
					
					 All these facts clearly show that the U.S. imperialists are the provoker of the Korean War.

articles.title: U.S. Should Remember Lesson Taught by Its Defeat in Korean War: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Should Remember Lesson Taught by Its Defeat in Korean War: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Sixty-seven years have lapsed since the U.S. provoked the Korean War in the 1950s.
					 It was a war of aggression premeditated by the U.S. imperialists out of their wild ambition for dominating the world.
					
					 On June 24, 1950 the then director of CIA told reporters that a war would break out in Korea that night or next morning. The British magazine Economist claimed that the U.S. could not but ignite a war as something sensational was badly needed for it to tide over its crisis.
					
					 Van Fleet, a defeated general of the U.S., asserted that if it had not been Korea, another country should have fallen victim to the war.
					
					 Dulles, a "special envoy" of Truman, "inspected" south Korea in order to finally check preparations for the Korean War and decided to ignite the war on Sunday, the "Sabbath" for Christian countries. The sly nature behind this scenario was fully disclosed.
					
					 But the U.S. is still working hard to provoke the second Korean war, styling itself "liberator" and "apostle of peace", in a bid to evade its responsibility for provoking the Korean War and shake off its disgrace as a defeated country.
					
					 It is driving the situation on the Korean peninsula to the brink of war by massively bringing its strategic assets one after another to put under its complete control the peninsula, which is of geographical importance in realizing its regional and global hegemony.
					
					 As the commander of the 2nd division of the U.S. forces in south Korea blustered that GIs would come back to the peninsula any time to fight, the U.S. hostility and war hysteria against the DPRK are getting evermore undisguised.
					
					 This shows that the U.S., which provoked the Korean War and invaded the DPRK, remains unchanged in its sinister design although 67 years have passed.
					
					 But the U.S. should never forget the lesson taught by its defeat. It was Korea where the myth of its "mightiness" knowing no defeat in more than a hundred wars was broken, and it was also Korea where it had to sign documents of apology over decades, suffering humiliations of defeat.
					
					 It is the will of the army and people of the DPRK to deal an unheard-of terrible blow at the U.S. which has committed untold crimes against the Korean nation century after century, and realize the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					 The U.S. will meet only an ignominious defeat in today's Korea which has emerged a nuclear power in the East to strike terror into the enemy and a rocket power in Asia.
					
					 The U.S. had better recollect once again the cries made by its defeated and buried generals in the 1950s who confessed that the U.S. fought a wrong war against a wrong rival at a wrong time in a wrong place.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop THAAD Deployment
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Taejon Headquarters of the Movement for the People's Sovereignty and Abolition of Evils in south Korea reportedly held a press conference outside the Taejon City Office on June 21, urging the authorities to stop the U.S. THAAD deployment.
					 Speakers at the conference said that they would no longer remain an onlooker to the acts of violating south Korea's sovereignty and threatening peace of the Korean peninsula in a bid to attain the hegemonic interests.
					
					 The people's demand is for the present "government", a product of the 17 million-strong candlelight action, to abolish the evil practices and the first target of such struggle is to set right the unequal south Korea-U.S. relations which have brought evils for over seven decades.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan Confrontation Farce
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan Confrontation Farce
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers are reportedly mulling staging an anti-DPRK farce on the lapse of 67 years since the start of the June 25 war.
					 The 22nd Division of the puppet army plans to conduct a live-fire drill on the coast of Kosong County, Kwangwon Province of south Korea, with tanks and machineguns involved on June 25 and show it to civilians and schoolchildren.
					
					 Meanwhile, they are going to stage another confrontation farce for nearly one week by inviting the mercenaries who took part in the last Korean War.

articles.title: Abolition of Evils in Police Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of Evils in Police Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Redemption and Prosperity Party of south Korea called a news conference on June 19 outside Chongwadae, at which it released a commentary of the spokesman office in demand of the abolition of the evil practices in the police, according to the south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo.
					 Noting the hospital of the Seoul National University confirmed that a water cannon of the police killed peasant Paek Nam Gi, the commentary demanded that Chongwadae remove vicious police officers such as the chief of the police agency from their posts and stamp out the evil practices in the police, though belatedly.
					
					 It declared that the Party would take a 100-day action in demand of the abolition of the evils in the police.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Austria
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Austria
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK posted on its website President Kim Il Sung's work "Go All Out for Victory in the War" on June 14 on the occasion of June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle and the 64th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The work is a radio speech made by the President to all the Korean people on June 26, Juche 39 (1950), one day after a war broke out in Korea.
					
					 It deals with the efforts exerted by the DPRK government to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and lays bare the aims sought by the U.S. imperialists and the Syngman Rhee puppet clique in igniting the war of aggression.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A Sri Lankan committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed in Colombo on June 19 to commemorate the 23rd anniversary of his demise.
					 The chairman of the Gampaha Branch of the Sri Lanka Society for Self-Reliance Studies was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold various events including a seminar on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A Czech committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Prague on June 17.
					 Josef Servista, deputy general secretary of the C.C., Czechoslovak Communist Party and vice-chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from June 20 to July 10 and decided to introduce the revolutionary career and exploits of the President through media and hold seminar, film show and other political and cultural events in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Seminars on leader Kim Jong Il's exploits took place in Russia, Indonesia, Egypt and Uganda on June 10 and 13 to mark the 53rd anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union said that Kim Jong Il had strengthened the WPK into a Juche-type revolutionary party for years and smashed the imperialist forces' moves to stifle the DPRK and firmly defended socialism and brought about changes in all fields with his unique Songun politics.
					
					 He stressed that the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il in party building and activities would shine forever with the WPK always emerging victorious.
					
					 The chairman of the Founding Committee of the Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia noted that Kim Jong Il built the WPK into the party of the leader which moves in the idea and will of President Kim Il Sung and into the powerful guiding force of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association and others praised the career of Kim Jong Il who dedicated his all to the strengthening of the WPK.
					
					 Referring to the feats Kim Jong Il performed for the era and history through his distinguished ideo-theoretical activities and gigantic revolutionary practices, personages of Uganda stressed the need to deeply study his revolutionary idea and apply it to their country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Russia
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Russian internet websites posted special write-ups between June 8 and 14 to mark the 53rd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The websites carried photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Zebri Deve, an online paper of Khabarovsk Territory, said that Kim Jong Il built the WPK into the party which is responsible for the people's destiny and serves them after forming a harmonious whole with the people and into the powerful political forces leading the Songun revolutionary cause.
					
					 The Arkhangelsk Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy of Russia said in an article posted on its website that Kim Jong Il put forward the Juche idea, the revolutionary idea of the leader, as the only guiding idea of the WPK and proclaimed it as the supreme programme of the Party to model all members of the society on Kimilsungism.
					
					 He made public a lot of works to give priority to strengthening the ideological position of socialism, it noted.
					
					 An online magazine Lemchich referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il made a ceaseless journey for the people all his life, guiding the officials to become devoted servants of the people.
					
					 Internet homepage Patrioti Moskva and the Dagestan Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy of Russia posted articles praising Kim Jong Il's history of guidance over the WPK.

articles.title: CRN publica acta de interpelacion abierta enviada a las autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
CRN publica acta de interpelacion abierta enviada a las autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional hizo publica ayer un acta de interpelacion abierta enviada a las autoridades surcoreanas.
					Segun el documento, todos los coreanos del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar apoyan y aprueban unanimemente la declaracion del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria, publicada con motivo del 17o aniversario de publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio para aclarar la posicion de principios de abrir la nueva era del desarrollo de relaciones intercoreanas y de la reunificacion independiente a base del noble ideal de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					Sin embargo, actuando conforme al estado de humor de EE.UU. y las fuerzas conservadoras, las actuales autoridades surcoreanas se mantienen calladas sobre el problema fundamental y de principios para la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas, lamenta el cuestionario y prosigue:
					
					Para colmo, ellas no vacilan en exponer su malsano intento de sancionar y presionar a la RPDC acusando absurdamente las justas medidas para el incremento de fuerzas armadas nucleares de autodefensa.
					
					Debido al comportamiento vacilante e inadecuado de ellas, los vinculos N-S no salen ni un poco del abismo de arruinamiento, al igual que en el poder conservador surcoreano.
					
					En nombre de toda la nacion, el Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional formula las siguientes preguntas a las autoridades surcoreanas:
					
					1. ?Tienen la voluntad de solucionar de manera independiente el problema de relaciones intercoreanas a base del ideal de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales" rechazando la confabulacion con las fuerzas foraneas?
					
					2. ?Seran capaces de tomar la decision resuelta de suspender los ejercicios militares conjuntos Sudcorea-EE.UU., factor principal de agravacion de la tension en la Peninsula Coreana?
					
					3. ?Estan dispuestas a cesar incondicionalmente la difamacion y la calumnia de toda indole que inculcan la desconfianza y la hostilidad entre los connacionales?
					
					4. ?Pueden responder a nuestra posicion de tomar primero las medidas practicas para eliminar el peligro de choque militar entre ambas partes coreanas?
					
					5. ?Estan preparadas a acudir al dialogo con nuestra parte sin hacer referencia al "problema nuclear del Norte"?
					
					6. ?Pueden dejar de "promover la sancion y presion al paralelo del dialogo" reconociendo que eso empeora aun mas las relaciones intercoreanas?
					
					7. ?Tomaran las medidas osadas para liquidar las consecuencias catastroficas de la ruptura total de relaciones intercoreanas, cometida por la banda traidora conservadora?
					
					8. ?Podran mostrar la voluntad de mejorar las relaciones N-S al devolver a nuestras ciudadanas secuestradas por la camarilla de conservadores?
					
					9. ?Tendran la intencion de sumarse a la aspiracion unanime y los esfuerzos de todos los connacionales del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar por la apertura de la conferencia conjunta nacional?
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben dar respuestas claras a ese cuestionario, que refleja la voluntad de toda la nacion, sin olvidar que todos los compatriotas del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar observan atentamente la actitud de ellas.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Filipe Jacinto Nwussi
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Filipe Jacinto Nwussi
Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Mozambique, Filipe Jacinto Nwussi, con motivo del dia nacional de este pais africano.
					  Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Mozambique continuaran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose, el remitente deseo de todo corazon la buena salud y felicidad del destinatario y los exitos en las tareas de el y el pueblo mozambiqueno para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: PTC felicita 55o aniversario de fundacion de FRELIMO
articles.content:
PTC felicita 55o aniversario de fundacion de FRELIMO
Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea envio el dia 24 un mensaje de felicitacion al Comite Central del Partido Frente de Liberacion Nacional de Mozambique, en ocasion del 55o aniversario de la fundacion de esa organizacion politica mozambiqueno.
					La misiva recuerda que durante 55 anos despues de su fundacion, el FRELIMO logro la independencia del pais mediante la lucha tenaz y alcanzo mayores exitos en el trabajo para defender la soberania de la nacion y obtener la seguridad politica y el desarrollo socioeconomico del pais.
					
					Expresa alegria de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre el PTC y el FRELIMO, que tienen excelentes tradiciones, se amplifican y se desarrollan conforme al interes de los pueblos de dos paises.
					
					Convencido de que sigan desarrollandose favorablemente las relaciones entre dos partidos, formula sincero voto por mayores exitos en las actividades del FRELIMO por lograr el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad del pais.
